designScenario.name: Landing Gear System
designScenario.description: Design a next-generation Landing Gear System integrating electro-hydraulic actuation, adaptive shock absorption, and AI-driven health monitoring. The system must ensure reliable operation in extreme conditions (-50°C to 70°C) while supporting aircraft weights up to 400,000 lbs. Includes smart predictive maintenance capabilities and triple-redundant safety systems compliant with EASA/FAA regulations.

details.description: Dual-mode actuation system must support both hydraulic and electric emergency deployment mechanisms
Integrated steering-by-wire system with mechanical backup for nose gear articulation
Full gear extension ≤2.5 seconds at 30,000 ft altitude with -40°C ambient temperature
Shock absorbers must dissipate 95% of vertical kinetic energy during 10 ft/s sink rate landings
Triple-redundant gear position confirmation system with independent sensor pathways
Automatic load redistribution during asymmetric gear deployment scenarios
5000-cycle maintenance interval for critical components with corrosion-resistant composite materials
Modular design allowing 90% component replacement within 4 hours using standard hangar equipment

systemComponents.name: Smart Control Unit
systemComponents.description: AI-powered control module with neural networks for predictive load management and failure anticipation

subComponents.name: Fault Prediction Processor
subComponents.description: ML-based analysis unit monitoring system wear patterns

subComponents.name: Triplex Voting System
subComponents.description: Triple-redundant decision-making core for safety-critical commands

systemComponents.name: Hybrid Actuation System
systemComponents.description: Dual-source (hydraulic/electric) gear deployment mechanism with automatic failover

subComponents.name: Electro-Hydraulic Actuator
subComponents.description: High-torque linear actuator with dual input power sources

subComponents.name: Backup EM Motor
subComponents.description: 300V DC motor for emergency gear extension

systemComponents.name: Adaptive Shock Strut
systemComponents.description: Self-regulating oleo-pneumatic shock absorber with real-time damping adjustment

subComponents.name: Smart Metering Pin
subComponents.description: Active flow control device optimizing damping characteristics

subComponents.name: Pressure Adaptive Chamber
subComponents.description: Variable-volume gas spring adjusting to impact forces

systemComponents.name: Health Monitoring Module
systemComponents.description: Network of distributed sensors with edge computing capabilities for structural health assessment

subComponents.name: Vibration Analysis Nodes
subComponents.description: MEMS-based accelerometers with FFT processing capabilities

subComponents.name: Stress Mapping System
subComponents.description: Fiber-optic strain gauge network covering critical load paths

relationships.description: Continuous bidirectional data exchange for real-time system diagnostics and predictive maintenance scheduling
Mechanical integration of actuation components into the shock strut assembly for synchronized load management
Actuation performance metrics directly influence health assessment algorithms and maintenance recommendations
Hierarchical control architecture where the Smart Control Unit manages multiple actuation subsystems

attributes.name: maxDynamicLoad
attributes.description: Peak dynamic load capacity during carrier landing scenarios (3.0g impact)

attributes.name: emergencyExtensionTime
attributes.description: Maximum allowable time for full gear deployment using backup power systems

attributes.name: dampingEfficiency
attributes.description: Minimum required energy absorption during maximum design descent rate impacts

attributes.name: sensorResolution
attributes.description: Minimum structural deformation detection capability for early failure prediction

attributes.name: temperatureRange
attributes.description: Operational temperature specifications for arctic/desert extreme conditions

comments.body: Complies with FAR-25.729 landing gear requirements
